quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Oxford and Article
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leviathan, grad. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Oxford graduate wrote Lord of the Flies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Golding

questions.question: This Oxford graduate wrote The Leviathan, a classic work on legitimate government and society.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Hobbes

questions.question: This Oxford scholar wrote The Wealth of Nations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Smith

questions.question: These two Oxford students were members of Monty Python.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Palin and Terry Jones

questions.question: Which Article deals with Ratification of the U.S. Constitution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: This Oxford scholar was a master of satire. He wrote A Modest Proposal, and An Argument  Against Abolishing Christianity.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jonathan Swift

questions.question: Article 4 of the U.S. Constitution deals with Relations Among the States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which section of the Legislative Branch gives U.S. Congress its powers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8

questions.question: This Oxford scholar dared to try spread freedom and was assassinated as a result.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benazir Bhutto

questions.question: This English philosopher wrote Two Treatises on Government , a philosophical work that had a great influence on the writers of the US Declaration of Independence and the US Constitution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Locke

questions.question: Which Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 27

questions.question: This Oxford graduate wrote the screenplay for the movie The Third Man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graham Greene

questions.question: What does Article 3 of the U.S. Constitution deal with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judicial Branch

questions.question: This neurologist was an Oxford grad who became famous for his athletic ability.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Bannister

questions.question: This Romantic poet lived 1788-1824. Among his best works are Don Juan and When We Two Parted.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Byron

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Oxford and Oxford Scholar
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, electricity, gardener. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Oxford scholar is given credit for developing the World Wide Web.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vannevar Bush

questions.question: He was a great British explorer, an orientalist, and, probably, the first non-Muslim to visit Mecca and Medina.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Burton

questions.question: This Oxford scholar and Indian Prime Minister was assassinated in 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indira Gandhi

questions.question: Ah, beauty and brains! This British beauty attended Oxford but left before graduation to become an actress. She was seen in Pearl Harbor, Laural Canyon, and Serendipidy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Beckinsale

questions.question: This English author depicts an Oxford scholar (Clerk) as one of the pilgrims in his most famous work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chaucer

questions.question: Denmark became a constitutional monarchy on June 5 in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1849

questions.question: This great scientist was able to show the equivalence of  electricity, magnetism and light  via a set of  equations that carry his name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Clerk Maxwell

questions.question: On June 5 in 1851 The Natonal Era began publishing a serial that took ten months to finish. The  serial which treated slavery was made into a very popular book. Who was the author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harriet Beecher Stowe

questions.question: This Oxford scholar is the author of a series of books about a teddy bear .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A.A. Milne

questions.question: On June 5 in 1661 Issac Newton was admitted to which college?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trinity College, Cambridge

questions.question: This Oxford scholar is credited with making the first mechanical computer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Babbage

questions.question: Who wrote The Spy Who Came in From the Cold and The Constant Gardener?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Le Carre

questions.question: He was, arguably, the greatest architect in British history. He designed St. Pauls Cathedral in London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Wren

questions.question: He was a great British mathematician, scientist, and philosopher. His attempt to give mathematics a complete axiomatic basis was foiled. In 1950 he won the Nobel Prize in Literature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bertrand Russell

questions.question: On June 5 in the year 70, the Romans first broke through the walls of Jerusalem. Who was their leader?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titus

quizzes.title: History Quiz: June and Year
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, schools, oktoberfest. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Unknown Rebel halted an entire column of Chinese tanks in Tiananmen Square on June 5 in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989

questions.question: 12th October 1582 does not exist in Italy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On 12 October in 1945, PFC Desmond T. Doss won the Congressional Medal of Honor for outstanding bravery as a medical corpsman and became the first conscientious objector in American history to receive the nations highest military award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The first fax across the Atlantic to Europe was sent on June 5 in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1924

questions.question: On June 5 in 1956 young Elvis Presley introduced his version of Hound Dog during his third appearance on a TV show. What was the show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milton Berle Show

questions.question: On October 12th, 1998, this University of Wyoming student was robbed, tortured and left for dead by two attackers outside of Laramie, Wyoming.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matthew Shepard

questions.question: What did children attending American public schools do for the first time on October 12, 1892?

options.text: were released from classes by the ringing of a bell

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: said the Pledge of Allegiance

questions.question: The Communications Act of 1912 forced amateur operators to take lengthy tests before a Department of Commerce examiner and issued commercial ship-to-shore call signs to early broadcasting stations. Name the Secretary of Commerce that oversaw this first step toward communication regulation in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herbert Hoover

questions.question: Which of these events did not occur on a  June 5?

options.text: The ever popular Kenny G. was born.
Robert Blake was found liable for the death of his  wife in a civil trial in 2000.
The Battle of France begins in World War II.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Blake was found liable for the death of his  wife in a civil trial in 2000.

questions.question: On June 5 during World War II, Rome was liberated from the Fascists. In what year did this happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1944

questions.question: On 12 October in 1810, the first Oktoberfest was held to celebrate the marriage of then Bavarian Crown Prince Louis (Ludwig) and his bride, Princess Therese von Sachsen-Hildburghausen. Near what city were the festivities held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Munich

questions.question: On October 12th 1492, after sailing across the Atlantic Ocean, Spanish explorer Christopher Columbus landed on a Bahamian island, thinking he had reached the Spice Islands of East Asia. He claimed the land for Isabella and Ferdinand of Spain, regardless of the indigenous population living there.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On 12 October, 1960,  Nikita Khrushchev pounded this on a desk at the United Nations General Assembly meeting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his shoe

questions.question: On June 5 in 1833 the first person acknowledged to be a computer programmer met  the person considered the father of modern computing. Who met whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ada Lovelace met Charles Babbage

questions.question: The USA began a program of Army registration day for World War I, on June 5 in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1917

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Nato and Radio
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, headquarters, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A commercial radio stations first job is to educate its audience
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The International Security Assistance Force (10), that started on 20 December 2001, is a NATO-led mission for security and development in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Afghanistan

questions.question: What does Gladio refer to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a NATO operation

questions.question: The reason for GEs purchase of the NBC Television Network is ironic - GE was forced to sell its RCA stock because RCA owned the fledgling broadcasting chain in the 1930s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Name this Dutch shortwave radio program that runned for a total of 77 years on Radio Nederland and its predecessor?

options.text: How the Dutch East India Company Came to be.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Happy Station

questions.question: Where was the North Atlantic Treaty signed on April 4, 1949?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Washington

questions.question: What is the NATO ACCS Management Agency responsible for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air control

questions.question: What states are eligible for NATO membership?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: European

questions.question: Radio Nederland, the BBC and Radio Berlin were three of the very few short wave radio stations broadcasting to international audiences before the 1930s. Short Wave referred to the wavelength of the radio frequencies such broadcasters used because they were much shorter than the typical 300 meter AM band used for commercial broadcasting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What NATO member state does not have its own standing army?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iceland

questions.question: What are the two countries referenced in the title of the Two Plus Four Treaty, which resulted in the first expansion of NATO after the Cold War?

options.text: East Germany and Federal Republic of Germany

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Germany and Federal Republic of Germany

questions.question: Who chairs the North Atlantic Council, the most senior political governing body of NATO?

options.text: the Chairman of the Military Committee

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Secretary General

questions.question: Operation Essential Harvest, meant to disarm ethnic Albanian groups, was carried out in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macedonia

questions.question: The first licensed commercial radio station in the United States was KDKA in Pittsburgh.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where is the headquarters of NATO?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brussels

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Flag and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, bird, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What interesting object is featured on the national flag of Grenada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clove of nutmeg

questions.question: What sounded the death knell for radio news on commercial radio stations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Radio Deregulation Act of 1981

questions.question: What is the only country in the world whose flag features a building?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambodia

questions.question: What bird is featured on the national flag of Papua New Guinea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raggiana Bird of Paradise

questions.question: Radio did not die when pictures were added just before World War I (Britain) or just after it (U.S.). How did it survive?

options.text: Aligning with the great movie production houses allowed poor mans  television
Created the combo-man (engineer and host) and began programming music to specific demographic cells.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Created the combo-man (engineer and host) and began programming music to specific demographic cells.

questions.question: What country has a crown depicted in the upper left corner of its flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liechtenstein

questions.question: What is the color of the star featured on the national flag of Morocco?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: Is the following information true?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The island of Tasmania has been called by this beautiful nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Island of inspiration

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present on the Seychelles flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: What is the name of the state capital of the Australian state of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hobart

questions.question: What animal which became extinct in the 20th century is depicted on the Coat of arms of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Why can one company own more than 200 radio stations in the United States?

options.text: To better saturate local markets with advertising
So that certain country and western music can be heard in any U.S. radio market
To better present potential and existing sponsors (national, regional and local) the ability to easily purchase listeners in a market

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To better present potential and existing sponsors (national, regional and local) the ability to easily purchase listeners in a market

questions.question: Which of these colors is not present on the national flag of the Bahamas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green

questions.question: What is the only country in the world whose national flag is not rectangular?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nepal

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Tasmania and Title
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The title of the national anthem of India is Jana Gana Mana. What does this mean?

options.text: Thou Shall Listen to the Voice of the Prince
Thou Art the Ruler of the Minds of All People

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thou Art the Ruler of the Minds of All People

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Japan?

options.text: Until the Earth Comes to an End

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: May Your Reign Last Forever

questions.question: What country has a national anthem entitled Chosen Land?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Philippines

questions.question: How many distinct seasons are characteristic of the climate of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four seasons

questions.question: The Bayamo Anthem is the title of the national anthem of this island country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba

questions.question: Oh, Bright Dawn of May is the national anthem of this European country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montenegro

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Advance Australia Fair

questions.question: My Fatherland, My Happiness and Joy is the title of the national anthem of this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Estonia

questions.question: What is the island of Tasmania named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Explorer

questions.question: What animal became one of the symbols of the island and state of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tasmanian Devil

questions.question: What celebrated Hollywood actor was born on the island of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Errol Flynn

questions.question: What is the official motto of the Australian state of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fertility and Faithfulness

questions.question: What country adopted The March of Independence as its national anthem?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkey

questions.question: Tasmania is famous for the production of this alcoholic beverage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wine

questions.question: What are the colors of the official state flag of Tasmania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue, white and red
